Review.Titre: Still waiting for payment..a over a…
Review.Contenu: Still waiting for payment..a over a week later. Not forthright w offer half like many reviews say. keep waiting for payment but they have expensive phone mailed in n trust. I see lots of folks saying same gets pushed by baiting folks with 600 or 700 dollar or 800 offer get your phone and email low ball to 200 say it's a junk phone parts  and then never to b heard from. L. Thought of calling authorities if don't receive money or phone back.

I feel scammed that I was only offered half of the offer price.  I wiped the phone and removed the sim card. After arrival, they emailed me several times asking for the "old password" I'm not sure why this is needed as the device was wiped. After giving all my old passwords, they still claimed they couldn't format it, but somehow offered me half as much. Because it was taking too much time I accepted the lower offer. Not sure what they could do with the phone if they truly couldn't get access.

Sent my phone to them in mint condition. They claimed it was scratched and downgraded my offer (I always had a screen protector on it, never a single scuff or scratch). Declined their offer and received my phone back with 5 scratches on the screen. SCAM- BEWARE OF SAVEGADGET

Review.Titre: Sold my 13pro since I got a 15pro.
Review.Contenu: I sold my phone that was always in a case with the original box and charging cord. I was then told the damage was excessive, enough to knock it down a tier. I think they did this due to the decrease in trade values because of the 15 and 15pros coming out. Then paypal didn't trust save gadget and were going to hold the funds for 2 weeks. Never going yo trade to them right as a new model comes out.

Review.Titre: Disappointed, the phone I sent was in excellent condition
Review.Contenu: The iPhone 12 Max I sent was in excellent condition. Always had a protective case and glass shield. However, they only paid $378.00. Instead of the $500.00 their system said I was going to receive. You are better off selling through another company. In addition, I decide to get the money via PayPal, I've been doing business with that platform for many years, and not until I did business with SaveGadget, I got a fraudulent invoice from a scammer. coincidence...?

The communication (emails) was lacking & poor . I would not describe the process as fast but rather slow (it took almost a month to process) and I believe I may still be waiting for my payment if I had not had to complain to mother company Cellsell . In the future I would avoid this company and not recommended them to others based on my recent experience.

Review.Titre: They paid me WAY less money then…
Review.Contenu: They paid me WAY less money then originally promised. My phone had one thing wrong with it. The screen wasn't even cracked! If they were going to change the payment amount, they should've at least notified me before issuing a check. I will never use this company again and I don't recommend them

Review.Titre: Many good comments here are operated by their own company...

When I asked for the missing a picture, they refused to. And then told me that all part of my watch was smashed. They can’t get the story straight. They can send me a picture so now I’m waiting to see when my package comes back if it’s even my watch and what they did to it. Very disappointing. Will never use them again I think they should be looked into fraud.

Savegadget: We've inspected your device(s) and noticed some differences in condition you listed your gadget. Inspection results: During the inspection, we found that the phone has scratches on the frame, scratches around the charging port; Scratches on the screen. As per the "Mint" condition description, a device visually should have no wear and tear, has absolutely no scratches, scuffs, or other marks, and looks brand new. In case when the device has scratches and dings, it will classify as Good condition. The adjusted Offer is $691 (the original offer was $813)Me:There aren’t no scratches or damages on my iPhone 14 pro max. I examined my phone throughly on all sizes and I’ve gotten my phone inspected just in case something like this would to occur. It’s in perfect condition I recorded my phone before and after as I was sending it out I’m not sure if your intention is to lowball me but I know my phone is worth $800+. If you disagree with the original offer then you can send my phone back. If there’s appear to be any damages on the phone what’s so ever you will be held liable  for any damages to my phone IPhone 14 pro max.On Aug 16, 2023, at 7:38 AM, Michael savegadget.con wrote: We Hello, Thanks for the quick reply.I see that iPhone has scratches on the frame, scratches around the charging port; Scratches on the screen.Unfortunately, due to these findings, we can accept the phone as Good, not Mint.What would be the best offer you would accept for this iPhone?We are trying to close the deal.Regards,MichaelMe: I’m no longer interested in doing business with this company I see that ya’ll intention is to lowball me again I have proof that my phone is in excellent condition there are no scratches on the phone  if the original offer isn’t what you trying to offer me then you can send me back my phone.On Aug 16, 2023, at 2:37 PM, Michael savegadgadget Sure, we will return it back to you.Regards,MichaelMe: You lied and said there were scratches on my iPhone 14 pro max and underneath the bottom part of my phone.  There are no scratches. I received my phone today and I notice they’re a white spect on the left side of my phone that wasn’t there before. I’ve mentioned before any damage on my phone during the time it was in  savegadget care Savegadget is responsible for the full pay out of the phone. My iPhone 14 pro max is consider as damaged. This can be resolved before legal matter takes place. Compensate me how? I can send the phone back and get the offer that was mention before or legal matters will be placed.On Aug 22, 2023, at 8:55 PM, Michael savegadget﻿Good evening,Just to let you know, we have received the phone in the condition described in the inspection results.We do not damage customers' devices. Our inspection process is strict and straightforward.We have returned the phone to you in the same condition we received it. Unfortunately, we won't be able to payout for the phone.Regards,Support - SaveGadgetThis company constantly lie to customers do not go to this company they’re scammers take my word don’t go to them!!!
“BUYERS BEWARE “!!!Incompetent!Low~balled me after agreeing to a different price!Never again!

Have never received my check!!!!!! Very Disappointed!!!!!!

Review.Contenu: Money still on hold in PayPal after 8 days…

Review.Titre: Gave me a lot less than they offered

Review.Contenu: This company did what I call the bait and switch they give you a high or highest bid offer for your phone then when they receive it it’s a different story and one of the excuses they gave me after I’d sent them my phone was that it wasn’t paid off so that ended up knocking off like 200 or more off the original appraisal they had all the info before they received the phone so if that was the issue they should have mentioned that from the beginning I don’t recommend using there service I regret it and there rip off tactics are deceiving by offering the highest dollar for your phone to get it in there hands then your f****d!

Review.Titre: Not honest, would recommend you sell elsewhere.
Review.Contenu: There are definitely some things that could be improved on and honesty is a must, and this company lacks that. First thing that needs improvement is the fact people are sending in devices worth a lot of money, yet can't see updates on where their package is?? Seems so outdated to me considering it's 2023 and every other buyback site allows for updates on where your package is, yet on here I had no clue if it was ever scanned at the post office. Second things that needs improvement is the fact there was absolutely no way to accept or decline the updated offer, leaving me to believe they just hope people won't respond and by default except the much lower price. They also are very dishonest and it proves it when I got a quote for Samsung Galaxy 23 128 GB at $401, but sent them a Samsung Galaxy s23+ 256 GB, which they pay $551 for. After the review they said it was financed so only offering me $168, but failed to mention the $150 increase because it was a better phone. It's unfair to take advantage of people and even worse to make them jump through hoops to receive they are deserved. I am hoping it doesn't take forever for a response from customer service as I need this money for my son's wedding in September.

Review.Titre: PayPal Fees charged. You will not get agreed price.
Review.Contenu: Sent in phone and they came back that it was still somehow connected to the carrier and they could not resell. Cleared up with carrier and responded the same day. It took more than a week - after numerous emails to get a response. Opted for PayPal payment but was charged a fee by PayPal. I suspect that SaveGadget put it as an immediate payment that resulted in the charge. If not they should explicitly state that you will not get the agreed upon price as PayPal will deduct a fee. If SaveGadget is charging the fee for using PayPal, then the payment should be increased to reflect the agreed upon price.

Review.Titre: Nothing wrong with the service it was…
Review.Contenu: Nothing wrong with the service it was great however I have not yet received payment due to PayPal holding my money. If it’s easier to get funds without having to jump through useless hoops that would be great. Would still try again just a different payment form
I marked mint condition and it was so but they reduced nearly $120 on phone later saying it has dents, which it never had
my amount got reduced by 50%.....

Well I'm pretty sure my screen had no cracks on it or at least before I sent it there's no cracks on it I do have pictures before I sent it also I don't know how there was dings or dents on the other parts from the day if left the store it's been in a phone case so but y'all were the only ones that didn't  ask if the phone was paid off or not which it's not it was just rooted to make it look like it was. Review.Titre: My experience with Save Gadget was not as good as I had hoped …
Review.Contenu: My experience with Save Gadget was not as greats I thought it would be.  The quote for my iPhoneX working ,with a cracked screen was around 70$. I was able to print a label and mail them my phone with no issues. The amount I finally was quoted was 18$.  The battery health was low and that took off another 50$??   Wouldn’t that be included in the refurbishing process anyways.  I had a problem logging into my account and customer service was very quick answer my email & help.   I was expecting a digital check , I check my email for a week and nothing came.  I had two unanswered emails to support and then a paper check arrived in the mail.  It was at least 15 days from when I sent the phone.  I was not impressed with this service.

Review.Titre: The language and reasoning given for…
Review.Contenu: The language and reasoning given for the reduction in value was not professional and ruined the customer experience. For a 15% reduction in value, your company should have honored the initial amount rather than leaving the customer with the feeling of bait and switch.

Review.Titre: Free label was unusable, reimbursement denied for a proper label
Review.Contenu: I recently completed an iPhone trade-in with SaveGadget. While they made a competitive offer which they honored without complications, and had a quick turnaround time, I wasn't very impressed with their customer service. They claim to provide a "free pre-paid shipping label" for trade-ins, but their label ended up being unusable for my particular case. They provided me with a USPS First Class shipping label. For those unfamiliar with USPS shipping regulations, USPS does not permit shipment of cell phones with a lithium battery via a First Class label. Unfortunately, I found this one out the hard way and the label was refused at the counter. I was forced to pay $10.50 for my own Retail Ground label, since walking away wasn't exactly an option when I also needed to pay for and pack a box on-site. I immediately documented the issue in a support e-mail to them after sending the package out and requested reimbursement for the corrected label. SaveGadget didn't bother to get back to me until after they processed the trade-in, refused to reimburse me, and ghosted me when I explained they made an error with their shipping label and was denied a good faith attempt to use it. It didn't seem very fair to me that I have to bear the cost of their mistake. I can't help but feel misled and swindled, and assuming they won't make this right, will likely avoid trading with them again. It's disappointing that an otherwise decent experience was tarnished by an unreasonable insistence on policy.

Review.Titre: Hadn't get payment until I submit for…
Review.Contenu: Hadn't get payment until I submit for request after 5 days they received the item. Got the payment finally.

Being handicapped makes one very vulnerable, and once having been badly scammed on the internet, I was very reluctant to try again to enter into a transaction of selling my phone on line. From the start, however,I felt secure with SafeGadget. Everything was transparent and “up front”, I wished I was offered a better price, but it was a fair and competitive one and more importantly an honest and safe one. I highly recommend SafeGadget to anyone looking for a safe place to do business! Grateful customer

Review.Titre: After inspection the condition of my…
Review.Contenu: After inspection the condition of my iPhone was downgraded because the battery maximum capacity was 78%.  All that is said about battery life in the FAQs is a battery that lasts less than 1 hour is an issue.  The battery on my iPhone did last much longer than 1 hour.  The battery life issue should be addressed more clearly in the FAQs.

I shipped my phone based on an offer I was given. Upon receipt of my phone I received a much lower figure.  It only took 1 email to clarify my position and they immediately reconsidered and approved their original offer. Thank you for being a stand up company.

Super quick payout, this company is the best way to sell your old device! I contacted SaveGadget for a quote and got a response so quickly! They give you more for your items than any other company and the process was extremely fast. I was shocked at the low quote for a iPhone 12 Pro Max even though there was an issue with my device that I wasn't aware of! Would definitely recommend, very honest people.

I claimed my device was in Mint condition, less than a year old, no scratches/nicks on the body or frame, yet the receiving staff downgraded it from the maximum to a lower reward. Simply was not clear so I accepted the offer without bias

Got there in a couple of business days, received an inspection the same day that agreed with my assessment, and I received funds via PayPal the next day. Could not have been a better experience.
The whole process was very easy. I was satisfied with the speed of payment and the simple process of sending the device in.
Great service.  Easy.  Received payment quickly.  Will definitely use again

Review.Titre: I was so skeptical when I first saw…

You know, since they’re such a reputable company (worst ever I’m now realizing). But I did my research and decided to tell Xfinity they can shove it. Just as SaveGadget explained how it worked was exactly my experience and I received nearly $400 for the phone. Never trade your phone anywhere else except with SaveGadget.

Review.Titre: Great!If you enjoy being lied to while getting screwed!

I was sent a much lower figure with a few pictures of a phone that was not mine.  I asked them to turn on the phone in the pictures to see the serial number and IMEI.

Review.Titre: The shipping process was pretty quick but not payment.

So if you’re okay with waiting a while to get your payment then I would recommend them as far as customer service and shipping but not for receiving payment.UPDATE: 20 minutes after this review they responded and contacted PayPal for me and they released the funds. Review.Titre: They were fair and honest with me
Review.Contenu: They were fair and honest with me. The screen was messed up real bad to where the FaceTime did not work. They initially updated my quote to reflect that there was more than one issue with the phone which placed it in a lower price bracket. I reached out and asked if they could take a second look as I thought the FaceTime still worked - there was just glass obstructing it. They went out of their way to verify this and make me a better offer while they were in a position of power to not negotiate with me and say “take our initial offer or pay to have it shipped back to you.” I appreciate the way they did business with me and would very much recommend them. Thank you all!

I was so disappointed when my husband dropped his Apple Watch and the screen cracked. Nothing else was wrong with it, but obviously it was ruined. The process of selling was very easy and sending it back was free and convenient. I will definitely use SaveGadget again!
